post.title: If you're in a relationship, you're expected to simp.

author.bio: I don’t hate anybody, and especially not you, dear lurker.
author.bio_html: I don’t hate anybody, and especially not you, dear lurker.

body:
> You have to constantly simp, give validation, and buy gifts to have a chance at keeping a below average womanlet.

You are completely wrong.

Women want to create the impression that you should simp, in order to see if you'll ACTUALLY do it. If you do simp, you demonstrate that you do not have alternative options, and therefore that other women don't want you, and furthermore that you are a pushover who is low in the dominance hierarchy, likely also because you are not competent enough to become a leader who can assert their vision.

Why on earth would a woman just tell a guy what to do to keep her or get in her pants? Would that not make sexual selection redundant?

post.title: If you're in a relationship, you're expected to simp.

author.bio: I don’t hate anybody, and especially not you, dear lurker.
author.bio_html: I don’t hate anybody, and especially not you, dear lurker.

body:
Consider the biological imperatives of women as: validation from dominant males of higher SMV, and security.

We know that if she has settled for someone she considers not a chad, she does gain some validation but is primarily settled for security. She values chad validation much higher.

I do not think her sexual selection has been gamed here. Rather, I think the man has been gamed to relinquish his biological incentives.

And why? Cuckoldry. A woman may have a male for security and seek other males for validational sex that she actually *wants*. Perhaps during girls night out. Perhaps then passing off the alpha’s child as the beta’s child.

Sexual selection successful.

Again, telling a man how to get her attracted is not in her best interests. It’s actually not even possible for most women to do that.
